Fonts tricky R. ’re trouble, read excellent explainer June Choe.

title: Data Visualization Tools for Teal Emery + Teal Insights
text: core tealviz package series ggplot2 custom themes, custom colors/palettes.  Title Subtitle use ggtext hood. adds powerful functionality, explored vignette. now, know auto-wrap subtitle can provide commentary visualizations key takeaways without worrying line breaks.
code: library(tealviz) #> [32mSuccessfully hoisted 6 font(s) for the family 'Roboto': Roboto Bold, Roboto Italic, Roboto Bold Italic, Roboto Regular, Roboto Regular, Roboto Bold[0m #> [32mThe following font(s) for the family 'Roboto' are already loaded: Roboto Medium[0m #> [32mSuccessfully hoisted 6 font(s) for the family 'Roboto Condensed': Roboto Condensed Italic, Roboto Condensed Light Italic, Roboto Condensed Bold Italic, Roboto Condensed Bold, Roboto Condensed Light, Roboto Condensed Regular[0m #> [32mSuccessfully hoisted 8 font(s) for the family 'Lora': Lora Italic, Lora SemiBold Italic, Lora Regular, Lora Bold, Lora SemiBold, Lora Medium Italic, Lora Medium, Lora Bold Italic[0m #> [32mSuccessfully hoisted 8 font(s) for the family 'Inconsolata': Inconsolata Bold, Inconsolata SemiBold, Inconsolata Light, Inconsolata Medium, Inconsolata ExtraLight, Inconsolata Black, Inconsolata Regular, Inconsolata ExtraBold[0m # On loading the package, the `font_hoist()` function automatically makes sure the fonts are available for use. You will see messages in the console to inform you whether the fonts loaded correctly or not.  library(ggplot2) #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.3.1  palmerpenguins::penguins |>   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = bill_length_mm,                  y = flipper_length_mm,                  size = body_mass_g,                  fill = body_mass_g),              shape = 21,              color = ti_colors$background) +   labs(title = "Perfectly proportional penguins",        subtitle = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.",        x = "Bill length (mm)",        y = "Flipper length (mm)",        fill = "Body mass (g)",        caption = "Demo plot, built with {palmerpenguins}") +   guides(size = "none") +   scale_fill_ti(continuous = TRUE) +   theme_ti(title_font = "Roboto Condensed Bold",            base_font = "Roboto Condensed",            background_color = TRUE,            void = FALSE)  #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

title: Make font families available in ggplot2 — font_hoist
text: See June Choe's blog post explaining . function requires user already downloaded font computer, set ragg described blog post.

title: Make font families available in ggplot2 — font_hoist
code: # load Roboto Condensed (must be loaded from Google Fonts on system already) font_hoist("Roboto Condensed") #> No fonts found for the family 'Roboto Condensed'.  #> Make sure that the font is downloaded to your computer, and that you can find it using systemfonts::system_fonts(). If you are having trouble, check out June Choe's helpful blog post on setting up and debugging custom fonts: https://yjunechoe.github.io/posts/2021-06-24-setting-up-and-debugging-custom-fonts/ #> NULL  # try loading a font not on your computer, or that doesn't exist. It will give an informative error message. font_hoist("Lobster Monster") #> No fonts found for the family 'Lobster Monster'.  #> Make sure that the font is downloaded to your computer, and that you can find it using systemfonts::system_fonts(). If you are having trouble, check out June Choe's helpful blog post on setting up and debugging custom fonts: https://yjunechoe.github.io/posts/2021-06-24-setting-up-and-debugging-custom-fonts/ #> NULL

title: Applying the color palettes to the color aesthetic within the plots — scale_color_ti
code: scale_color_ti(   palette = "default",   reverse = FALSE,   continuous = FALSE,   .aesthetic = "color",   .colors = ti_colors,   .palettes = ti_palettes,   ... )

title: Applying the color palettes to the color aesthetic within the plots — scale_color_ti
text: palette TI palette want use. Choose "default", "teal_to_gold", "teal_to_crimson", "cool_colors", "warm_colors", "skip_gold", "neg_to_pos", "us_rep_to_dem" "divergent" reverse Logical. Default FALSE. TRUE reverses palette (e.g. makes "neg_to_pos" start positive end rather negative end colour palette). continuous Logical. Default FALSE. Change TRUE applying color scale continuous variable .aesthetic Default "color". Can changed "fill", best use scale_fill_ti() apply colour palettes fill aesthetic. .colors Used access ti_colors. Please leave . .palettes Used access ti_palettes. Please leave . ... Additional arguments pass ggplot2::continuous_scale / ggplot2::discrete_scale (e.g. guide, limits, etc.)

title: Applying the color palettes to the fill aesthetic within the plots — scale_fill_ti
text: palette TI palette want use. Choose "default", "teal_to_gold", "teal_to_crimson", "cool_colors", "warm_colors", "skip_gold", "neg_to_pos", "us_rep_to_dem" "divergent" reverse Logical. Default FALSE. Change TRUE reverse palette (e.g. make "neg_to_pos" start positive end rather negative end colour palette). continuous Logical. Default FALSE. Change TRUE applying color scale continuous variable .aesthetic Default "fill". Can changed "color", best use scale_color_ti() apply color palettes color aesthetic. .colors ti_colors .palettes ti_palettes ... Additional arguments pass ggplot2::continuous_scale / ggplot2::discrete_scale (e.g. guide, limits, etc.)

title: theme_ti — theme_ti
text: theme_ti

title: theme_ti — theme_ti
code: theme_ti(   title_font = "Roboto Condensed Bold",   base_font = "Roboto Condensed",   void = FALSE,   show_grid_lines = TRUE,   base_text_size = 11,   background_color = TRUE,   .colors = ti_colors )

title: theme_ti — theme_ti
text: title_font default title "Roboto". swich matching Serif font picked design phase (Lora), use title_font = "fancy". change different font (e.g. match external publication requirement), simply change desired (e.g. \"Times New Roman\"). Make sure installed fonts want use device first! base_font default font "Roboto"). want use different font (e.g. match external publication requirement), simply change desired (e.g. "Arial"). Make sure installed fonts want use device first! void Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, grid lines axes removed. useful creating pie/donut charts. show_grid_lines Logical (TRUE/FALSE). FALSE, grid lines removed axis text retained. base_text_size Base text size pt. relative size title / subtitle text margins derived . background_color Logical. default (TRUE) adds light color background line Teal Insights color palette. Change FALSE white background. .colors Used read ti_colors. Please leave !

title: theme_ti — theme_ti
text: object returned. Instead, theme applied ggplot plot.

what: Set of colors used in the Teal Insights color palettes and theme — ti_colors
title: Set of colors used in the Teal Insights color palettes and theme — ti_colors
text: Anchor colors used create TI color palettes. can also used stand-alone colors (e.g. ti_colors$gold returns hex code \"#f8c03e\")

text: Palettes created using TI anchor colors. view list palettes associated hex codes, use ti_palettes). Note palettes used plots interpolate anchor colors, allowing palette used number colors (within reason!)
